event: Here is the extracted table of clinical events and timestamps:
functional endoscopic sinus surgery (FESS) with nasal polypectomy
right sided keratoconus treated with a previous corneal graft
pus aspirates collected from both nasal cavities
contrast-enhanced computed tomography (CT) of the head and sinuses
bony erosion of the lateral walls of both ethmoid sinuses
soft tissue bulging into the right orbit
treatment for sepsis and presumed meningitis initiated
admitted to the critical care unit (CCU)
follow-up with the critical care and ENT teams
vivid memories of stay on CCU
no signs of post-traumatic stress disorder
managed medically as an outpatient by the ENT team
contrast-enhanced magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain, orbits and postnasal space
Aspergillus and Alternaria specific IgE levels within normal range
